Analysis of Compound Extreme Events

Javed Ali

Website Twitter Github LinkedIn Email

Javed is a Water Resources Engineer and Graduate Research Assistant in the Coastal Risks and Engineering Lab at University of Central Florida (UCF). His work involves multi-hazards risk assessment and analyzing compound climate/weather extreme events and their spatio-temporal interactions and socioeconomic impacts using machine learning and statistical methods.

References

  1. Ali, J., Wahl, T., R. Enriquez, A., & Rashid, M. M. (2021). Estimating Impact Relevant Thresholds of Multi-hazards in the US Southeast Coast. American Geophysical Union Fall Meeting 2021, New Orleans, LA. https://doi.org/10.1002/essoar.10508922.1

  2. Ali, J., Wahl, T., R. Enriquez, A., & Rashid, M. M. (2022). A Novel Approach for Assessing Compounding Effects of Weather and Climate Extremes. UCF Graduate Research Forum 2022, Orlando, FL.

  3. Ali, J., Wahl, T., R. Enriquez, A., & Rashid, M. M. (2022). Assessing Compound Impacts of Natural Hazards in Miami-Dade County, Florida. 5th International Conference on Advances in Extreme Value Analysis and Application to Natural Hazard (EVAN), Orlando, FL, USA.
